page.title: 11Quantock Flowers
page.content: The {heather}turns parts of the Quantocks purple in August.There are three heathers to be found. {Ling}the commonest, the earlier{Bell heather} with larger flowers and in the wetter places the {Cross- leaved.} With these are patches of{Bracken} and {Whortleberry}-good for pies and jam and nice with ice-cream. In spring and summer the goldon{gorse}flowers and later you can hear the seed pods popping. Red stemmed{Dodder}twists all over gorse. It is a parasite. Yellow Tormentil{Eyebright}and{Cow-wheat} are found on the sides of paths, while by the streams is the {forget-me-not {watermint }and{yellow flag }and in the woods{bluebells }then {foxgloves {and honeysackle}perfumne the air while flowering {ivy }attracks wasps and other insects.
